method: Start out by completing the Archaeology tutorial by speaking to Acting Guildmaster Reiniger at the Archaeology Campus . Upon completion players will have obtained level 5 Archaeology and should progress to the Kharid-et Dig Site .

Go to the Kharid-et Dig Site, talk with Dr Nabanik , and view the cutscene. Afterwards, walk down the slope, uncover the venator remains , and excavate these. They will give damaged venator light crossbows and damaged venator dagger . To make a start on the artefact collections, you should save two light crossbows and two daggers after restoring them and hand them in to Soran and Velucia to contribute to their collection logs. Artefacts from Venator remains Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Venator dagger 305.1 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) N/A Venator light crossbow 305.1 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) N/A

At level 12 speak to Dr Nabanik again to receive a damaged centurion's seal and begin the Breaking the Seal mystery. Excavate the dirt pile blocking the doorway that leads into the rest of Kharid-et dig site. Restore the centurion's seal and click on the excavated door frame to enter Kharid-et - Barracks excavation site . Head to the first building on the west side, to find the legionary remains and excavate them. To continue with your collection log, you should expect to save two Primis Elementis standards , legionary gladius , and legionary square shields . One damaged gladius can be obtained from the Demon Door research mission once you complete your first Archaeology qualification if you prefer. While you are excavating at the barracks excavation site (recommended for level 12-24 and 25-28) you will randomly receive custodian's log pages. There are a total of four pages to find; once they are discovered you should complete the Prison Break mystery. This is the first excavation hotspot at the Kharid-et dig site where you can find pylon batteries while excavating. The batteries are used to charge pylons in the main fortress, which gives an amount of Archaeology experience which is dependent on your level and the number of batteries used. When the pylons are fully charged, by players contributing batteries across all game worlds, the Protection of Zaros status effect is activated. This gives +10% Archaeology experience, +5% mattock precision, an increased chance to obtain tetracompass pieces and complete tomes, and a small chance of finding a piece of the inquisitor staff . Artefacts from Legionary remains Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Primis Elementis standard 430.8 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) N/A Legionary gladius 430.8 2 Demon Door Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) N/A Legionary square shield 430.8 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) N/A

At level 17, move to the castra debris located right in front of the sealed door. Save two restored Zarosian effigies and Zarosian training dummies for Soran and Velucia. Save an additional Zarosian training dummy so that you can unlock Katarina as a researcher for your team once you unlock your research team. Alternatively, a damaged Zarosian training dummy can be obtained from the Demon Door research mission if you prefer, once you unlock the team. Artefacts from Castra debris Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Zaros effigy 520.5 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) N/A Zarosian training dummy 520.5 3 Proving Grounds Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) Katarina

You will unlock the Infernal Source Dig Site at level 20, but you should stay at Kharid-et until you reach level 24. At level 24, go to the Infernal Source Dig Site. Upon using the lift, you will find yourself in the Star Lodge cellar . You will see a furnace missing three crests of Dagon , which must be replaced to complete the Eyes in Their Stars mystery. Three crests of Dagon are needed to complete the mystery. Open all of the Star Lodge storage boxes in the area to find one restored crest of Dagon and one damaged crest of Dagon . You will also find the books 'Doctrinas Cupidate' and 'Philisophia in Cubiculo' which can be read to gain 250 experience each and some materials. A third crest of Dagon should be found by excavating the lodge art storage hotspots. You need another four crests of Dagon for collections (making seven all together), and three 'Disorder' paintings. Artefacts from Lodge art storage Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Crest of Dagon 646.2 7 N/A Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Showy Fings ( Chief Tess ) Knowledge is Power ( Wise Old Man ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) Eyes in Their Stars (3 needed) 'Disorder' painting 646.2 3 N/A Anarchic Abstraction ( Art Critic Jacques ) Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) N/A Once you have acquired the required artefacts from lodge art storage, move to the lodge bar storage hotspots in the southern area. You need three hookah pipes and four opulent wine goblets for collections. An additional restored wine goblet is needed to recruit Dorian to your research team at level 40. One damaged goblet can be obtained from the Starry Eyed research mission if you prefer. While excavating the lodge art and lodge bar storage you will come across four founder's journal pages ; they can only be found at these hotspots. Once you have found them all complete the Eyes in Their Stars mystery using the three crests of Dagon you obtained earlier. Artefacts from Lodge bar storage Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Hookah pipe 574.4 3 N/A Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Smoky Fings ( Chief Tess ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) N/A Opulent wine goblet 574.4 4 Starry Eyed Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Smoky Fings ( Chief Tess ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) Dorian

Head back to the Kharid-et - Barracks excavation site in the main fortress of Kharid-et Dig Site and excavate administratum debris hotspots in the room to the south of the entrance. This is the last excavation hotspots where custodian's log pages can be obtained so make sure you have obtained all four of them and completed the Prison Break mystery before moving on. You should now have all the artefacts required to fully complete the Museum - Zarosian I and Zarosian I artefact collections for the first time. Artefacts from Administratum debris Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Legatus Maximus figurine 664.1 4 N/A Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Showy Fings ( Chief Tess ) Magic Man ( Wise Old Man ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) N/A 'Solem in Umbra' painting 664.1 3 N/A Museum - Zarosian I ( Velucia ) Imperial Impressionism ( Art Critic Jacques ) Zarosian I ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) N/A

Return to the Infernal Source Dig Site and go to the Dungeon of Disorder area. There are bookshelves here which can be searched to obtain the books 'Amor Dente' and 'Malum Infernale' and a cultist chores rota ; each of which can be read to gain 500 experience. Excavate the cultist footlocker spots in the south-east corner. Three greater demon masks , three imp masks , and three lesser demon masks are required to complete collections. One damaged imp mask can be obtained from the Abandon All Hope research mission at level 40. While excavating these spots you will accumulate four cultist's diary journal. Once you have them all complete the Embrace the Chaos mystery. If you walk further forward after completing the Embrace the Chaos mystery you will be greeted by a gargoyle who will prompt the start of the Contract Claws mystery. Contract Claws can be completed at this point. Artefacts from Cultist footlocker Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Imp mask 735.9 3 Abandon All Hope Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Hat Problem ( Wise Old Man ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) N/A Lesser demon mask 735.9 3 N/A Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Hat Hoarder ( Wise Old Man ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) N/A Greater demon mask 735.9 3 N/A Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Hat Hoarder ( Wise Old Man ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) How Do You Do, Fellow Demon (not consumed)

At level 36, move to the sacrificial altar pile in the north-west of the Dungeon of Disorder. You will need two Order of Dis robes and three ritual daggers to complete collections. One ritual dagger can be obtained from The Dark Underbelly research mission. You should be able to  fully complete the Museum - Zamorakian I and Zamorakian I artefact collections at this point. Artefacts from Sacrificial altar Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Order of Dis robes 861.5 2 N/A Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) N/A Ritual dagger 861.5 3 The Dark Underbelly Museum - Zamorakian I ( Velucia ) Magic Man ( Wise Old Man ) Zamorakian I ( Isaura ) I Made Dis (not consumed) With at least level 40 Archaeology the assistant qualification can be unlocked by meeting the achievements listed below and talking to Acting Guildmaster Reiniger (doing so will also complete the Secrets of the Monolith mystery): Qualification - Intern ( 5) – Complete the Archaeology tutorial. Archaeology 40 ( 5) – Reach level 40 in the Archaeology skill. Mystery Solver I ( 5) – Solve 1 of Gielinor's greatest mysteries. Collectors Assemble I ( 5) – Complete 1 unique collection for an archaeological collector. (X/1) The Discoverer IV ( 10) – Excavate damaged artefacts. (X/25) The Restorer IV ( 10) – Restore damaged artefacts. (X/25) If you have completed all the content available up to this point you should have meet all the requirements to complete the qualification. If you have not obtained enough materials to restore each artefact that you've discovered at this point, you should purchase materials from Grand Exchange . Avoid material caches unless absolutely necessary. With this qualification unlocked you can purchase the first set of upgrades from the Archaeology Guild Shop . You should purchase the upgrades to the soil box 's capacity, material storage containers ' capacity, and base mattock precision. You can also claim two material manuals , two hi-spec monocles , two tarpaulin sheets , and two cups of archaeologist's tea from Acting Guildmaster Reiniger. You can now also begin sending out teams to complete research . Recruit Katarina and Dorian to your research team by speaking to them around the Varrock Dig Site . You will need to give them the restored Zarosian training dummy and opulent wine goblet which you obtained earlier. You should complete the following special research, which is available at level 40: Mysterious Monolith: Existence Starry Eyed The Dark Underbelly Abandon All Hope Demon Door Proving Grounds After this complete the highest level general research available to you alongside training.

At level 42 head to the Everlight Dig Site and go through the cutscene. Excavate the prodromoi remains ; you will need two 'frying pans' and two hallowed lanterns to complete collections, as well as an additional 'frying pan' and two hallowed lanterns to complete mysteries. One damaged hallowed lantern can be obtained from the Lions and Unicorns and Centaurs, Oh My! special research mission at level 42 Archaeology. While excavating here (or later at monoceros remains from level 48-50) you will accumulate four queen's journal pages and may find icyene remains . Once you have all the journal pages you can complete the Queen of the Icyene mystery. When the icyene remains are found the Fallen Angels mystery can be completed. With level 40 Construction and 10 white marble (unnoted) the Statue of Hebe can be repaired. A restored hallowed lantern can then be added to the statue to gain 785 Archaeology experience and some materials . Artefacts from Prodromoi remains Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses 'Frying pan' 1,073.3 3 N/A Museum - Saradominist I ( Velucia ) Saradominist I ( Sir Atcha ) Fallen Angels Hallowed lantern 1,073.3 4 Lions and Unicorns and Centaurs, Oh My! Museum - Saradominist I ( Velucia ) Saradominist I ( Sir Atcha ) Statue of Hebe 'The Epic of Hebe'

Return to the Dungeon of Disorder section of the Infernal Source Dig Site and excavate the dis dungeon debris hotspot. This is the last hotspot where the cultist's diary pages can be obtained, so find all of these and complete the Embrace the Chaos mystery before moving on. Artefacts from Dis dungeon debris Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Branding iron 1,283.3 2 N/A Museum - Zamorakian II ( Velucia ) Zamorakian II ( Isaura ) N/A Manacles 1,283.3 2 N/A Museum - Zamorakian II ( Velucia ) Zamorakian II ( Isaura ) N/A

Go to the Kharid-et Dig Site and enter the Kharid-et - Carcerem excavation site (the prison). You will need to complete the Prison Break mystery to enter this area if you have not already done so. A restored legatus pendant can be added to the tool belt to allow access to more areas in the carcerem excavation site which are otherwise blocked by the legatus barrier . Return to the Everlight - Mass grave excavation site at Everlight Dig Site. Excavate the monoceros remains . If you have not already collected the four queen's journal pages and icyene remains, find these and complete Queen of the Icyene and Fallen Angels mysteries before moving on. At level 51 switch to the amphitheatre debris excavation hotpots at the Everlight - Amphitheatre excavation site . With level 40 Construction and 10 white marble (unnoted) the Statue of Mesomedes can be repaired. A restored everlight harp can then be added to the statue to gain 1,278 Archaeology experience and a hand of glory . Move to the ceramics studio debris hotspots at level 56. You should now be able to fully complete the Museum - Saradominist I and Saradominist I artefact collections for the first time. Artefacts from Ceramics studio debris Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Folded-arm figurine (female) 2,053.3 2 N/A Museum - Saradominist I ( Velucia ) Saradominist I ( Sir Atcha ) N/A Folded-arm figurine (male) 2,053.3 2 N/A Museum - Saradominist I ( Velucia ) Saradominist I ( Sir Atcha ) N/A

Return to the Kharid-et - Carcerem excavation site and pass through the legatus barrier to excavate the carcerem debris . One more 'Incite Fear' spell scroll is required to complete The Vault of Shadows quest. An additional restored pontifex signet ring should be added to the tool belt to allow the player to pass through the pontifex barrier to access further excavation hotspots. You may also wish to create a pontifex observation ring , which uses another pontifex signet ring. Artefacts from Carcerem debris Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Pontifex signet ring 2,193.3 5 Lockdown Museum - Zarosian II ( Velucia ) Blingy Fings ( Chief Tess ) Zarosian II ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) Pontifex barrier and The Vault of Shadows (tool belt) Pontifex observation ring 'Incite Fear' spell scroll 2,193.3 5 N/A Museum - Zarosian II ( Velucia ) Magic Man ( Wise Old Man ) Zarosian II ( Soran, Emissary of Zaros ) Imperial Sorcery ( Eblis ) The Vault of Shadows

At level 60 you can access the Senntisten Dig Site and excavate the ministry remains at the Senntisten - Cathedral excavation site . You can obtain the first Inquisitor's Memoirs page from this hotspot; this is required for the Secrets of the Inquisition mystery, a restored funerary urn of shadow is also needed. Ancient glass shards are found while excavating throughout the Senntisten Dig Site. These can be used to repair the four broken stained glass windows in the cathedral . To fully repair each window 100 ancient glass shards and level 80 Crafting are required. Repairing all the windows completes the Pane in the Glass achievement. Artefacts from Ministry remains Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Apex cap 2,333.3 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian V ( Velucia ) Religious Iconography ( Eblis ) N/A Curse tablet 2,333.3 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian V ( Velucia ) Imperial Sorcery ( Eblis ) N/A Funerary urn of shadow 2,333.3 3 The Hidden Chamber Museum - Zarosian V ( Velucia ) Urns of the Empire ( Eblis ) Secrets of the Inquisition

Return to the Everlight - Dominion Games stadium excavation site and excavate stadio debris . While excavating here you will be able to find five athlete's journal pages and complete the Fall and Rise mystery. These can also be found later while excavating at other hotspots in the Dominion Games stadium excavation site at level 69 and 100. You should now be able to complete the Museum - Zarosian V and Museum - Zarosian VI collections for the first time. Artefacts from Stadio debris Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Dominion discus 2,566.7 2 N/A Museum - Saradominist II ( Velucia ) Saradominist II ( Sir Atcha ) N/A Dominion javelin 2,566.7 2 N/A Museum - Saradominist II ( Velucia ) Saradominist II ( Sir Atcha ) N/A Dominion pelte shield 2,566.7 2 N/A Museum - Saradominist II ( Velucia ) Saradominist II ( Sir Atcha ) N/A

Go to the Senntisten - Cathedral excavation site and excavate the cathedral debris .  You can obtain the second Inquisitor's Memoirs page from this hotspot; this is required for the Secrets of the Inquisition mystery, a restored funerary urn of smoke is also needed. Pages one and two of A critic's review can only be obtained from cathedral debris; these are needed later to complete the Night Theatre mystery. Move to the Senntisten - Marketplace excavation site at level 63 and collect from the marketplace debris . You can obtain the third Inquisitor's Memoirs page from this hotspot;  a restored funerary urn of ice is also needed. A critic's review (article 4) (for the Night Theatre mystery) and a warning letter (for the Empty Children mystery) can only be obtained from the marketplace debris. You should also complete the Complete the Pattern, Solve the Puzzle special research. At level 64 move to the inquisitor remains in the marketplace excavation site. A critic's review (article 3) and pages three and four of the Inquisitor's Memoirs can only be uncovered at this excavation hotspot. You can complete the Finery of the Inquisition collection at this point. At level 65 go to the Infernal Source - Vestibule of Futility south excavation site and train at the Infernal Source - Vestibule of Futility south-east excavation site . Artefacts from Infernal art Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses 'Lust' metal sculpture 3,500 3 N/A Museum - Zamorakian II ( Velucia ) Showy Fings ( Chief Tess ) Zamorakian II ( Isaura ) N/A 'The Lake of Fire' painting 3,500 3 N/A Anarchic Abstraction ( Art Critic Jacques ) Museum - Zamorakian II ( Velucia ) Zamorakian II ( Isaura ) N/A

Return to the Senntisten - Marketplace excavation site and begin excavating the gladiator remains . At the colosseum gateway use the "enter (non combat)" option. While here you can obtain the fourth page of the Inquisitor's Memoirs and progress the Secrets of the Inquisition mystery using a restored funerary urn of blood, along with the three other funerary urns from previous excavation hotspots. It is recommended to complete up until the point where the Crossing that Bridge special research is sent out as soon as you can, as this is required to unlock the next excavation site. Additionally a scrawled note (for the Empty Children mystery) can only be obtained from this hotspot. After this has been obtained the mystery can be completed. Once you have reached level 67 and have completed the Crossing that Bridge research you can move to the Senntisten - Bridge excavation site . Excavate the citizen remains there. Pages six and seven of the Inquisitor's Memoirs can only be obtained at this site. The eighth page can only be obtained from the ministry remains hotspot after these have been obtained, so you will have to backtrack at this point to find it. You can then complete the Secrets of the Inquisition mystery. The fifth critic's review article can also only be obtained here, after finding it the Night Theatre mystery can be completed. There are four artefact collections which can be completed after this excavation hotspot: Museum - Zarosian VII , Entertaining the Masses , Religious Iconography , and Urns of the Empire . Artefacts from Citizen remains Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses 'The Serpent's Fall' carving 3,966.7 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian VII ( Velucia ) Religious Iconography ( Eblis ) N/A Model chariot 3,966.7 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian VII ( Velucia ) Entertaining the Masses ( Eblis ) N/A Funerary urn of miasma 3,966.7 2 N/A Museum - Zarosian VII ( Velucia ) Urns of the Empire ( Eblis ) N/A

At level 68 go to the Infernal Source - Vestibule of Futility north-east excavation site at the Infernal Source Dig Site . Excavate the shakroth remains . Before handing in the spiked collars you may want to complete the Who's a Bad Boy? achievement; the collar is not consumed while doing so. An additional restored chaos star can be added to your tool belt to prevent portals in the area from misfiring. You can then complete the Dagon Bye mystery, as it requires having a chaos star but one stored in the tool belt will work. After completing this mystery you should have completed all the Infernal Source site mysteries and will be able to recruit Movario to your research team. The Blingy Fings artefact collection can be fully completed for the first time at this point. (not consumed)

Return to the Dominion Games stadium excavation site and excavate the dominion games podium hotspots. Obtain three bronze dominion medals , three dominion torchs , and three silver dominion medals for collections. One dominion torch can be obtained by completing the Stadio Ga Ga special research mission. Restore the statue of Padosan with level 40 Construction and 10 white marble . Add a restored dominion torch to gain 2,470 Archaeology experience. Another dominion torch is required to complete the Hallowed Be... mystery later on. If you have not already, obtain all of the five athlete's journal pages and complete the Fall and Rise mystery. Artefacts from Dominion Games podium Artefact Restore XP Needed From research Collections Other uses Bronze Dominion medal 4,433.3 3 N/A Museum - Saradominist II ( Velucia ) Blingy Fings ( Chief Tess ) Saradominist II ( Sir Atcha ) N/A Silver Dominion medal 4,433.3 3 N/A Museum - Saradominist II ( Velucia ) Blingy Fings ( Chief Tess ) Saradominist II ( Sir Atcha ) N/A Dominion torch 4,433.3 5 Stadio Ga Ga Museum - Saradominist II ( Velucia ) Smoky Fings ( Chief Tess ) Saradominist II ( Sir Atcha ) Statue of Padosan Hallowed Be... With at least level 70 Archaeology the associate qualificiation can be unlocked by meeting the achievements listed below and talking to Acting Guildmaster Reiniger : Qualification - Assistant ( 10) – Complete all of the listed achievements and attend the qualification ceremony. Archaeology 70 ( 5) – Reach level 70 in the Archaeology skill. Mystery Solver IV ( 15) – Solve 10 of Gielinor's greatest mysteries. Collectors Assemble III ( 10) – Complete 5 unique collections for archaeological collectors. (X/5) The Discoverer VII ( 30) – Excavate damaged artefacts. (X/250) The Restorer VII ( 30) – Restore damaged artefacts. (X/250) The Researcher I ( 5) – Send your research team out on field studies. Tracked in hours. (X/24) However, you are not likely to have found and restored enough artefacts at this point to be able to complete the qualification straight away. You can either opt to continue training and unlock the qualification once you hit the required number of artefacts or return to a low level spot where artefacts can be uncovered and restored quickly. Venator remains work well for this. If you wish to complete collections for a better experience rate you could complete the Zarosian I or Museum - Zarosian I collections, both of which give a 4,271.8 experience completion bonus. With the associate qualification unlocked you can purchase the next set of upgrades from the Archaeology Guild Shop . You should purchase the upgrades to the soil box 's capacity, material storage containers ' capacity, and base mattock precision. You can also purchase the archaeologist's outfit , which gives a 5% increased experience gain when the full set is worn. You may wish to purchase the blueprints for the auto-screener v1.080 , which requires level 67 Invention to manufacture. With the auto-screener soil is automatically converted into materials available at the excavation hotspot that the player is using. The auto-screener does not yield any damaged artefacts or yield any Archaeology or Invention experience when converting soil. After completing the qualification three material manuals , three hi-spec monocles , three tarpaulin sheets , and three cups of archaeologist's tea may be claimed from Acting Guildmaster Reiniger by talking to her. You can now also recruit Alpheus and Eliza to your research team. They are located on Anachronia and will ask to join your team if you show them a completed totem . You can complete the Mysterious Monolith: Architecture special research.

At level 70 you will be invited to go to the Stormguard Citadel Dig Site . Head to the Temple of Ikov and study the northern or southern archway to uncover the Ikovian Tragedy special research. Send off your research team and start excavating the Ikovian memorial hotspots. Once you have obtained and restored an Ikovian gerege , either from the hotspots or from completing the special research, add it to your tool belt . Enter the citadel and continue excavating the Ikovian memorials . While excavating the Ikovian memorial hotspots inside the citadel there is a chance that you will find the boots of flight . When you find them you can add them to your tool belt and complete the Leap of Faith mystery. The exile's vow can only be found while excavating Ikovian memorial hotspots. When this is found talk to Gee'ka to complete the Atonement mystery. You can now complete the Museum - Saradominist II and Saradominist II collections for the first time. While excavating at hotspots within the Stormguard Citadel you can find torn blueprint fragments which are used to create blueprints for Ancient Invention ; however this cannot be unlocked until you reach level 95 Archaeology. Return to the Everlight - Oikoi excavation site and excavate the oikos studio debris piles. When you have unlocked the professor qualification you can complete the Mysterious Monolith: Symbology special research and automatically unlock Drew , Helen , and Easty for your research team. You can now purchase another set of upgrades from the Archaeology Guild Shop : to the soil box 's capacity, material storage containers' capacity, and base mattock precision . You can also purchase an additional relic loadout slot if you wish. Four material manuals , four hi-spec monocles , four tarpaulin sheets , and four cups of archaeologist's tea may be claimed from Acting Guildmaster Reiniger by talking to her after completing the qualification.

You can now access the Orthen Dig Site on Anachronia for the first time. Upon arriving speak to Mr Mordaut to view a cutscene; active the inactive teleport device east of the base camp lodestone; and then head to the Orthen - Crypt of Varanus excavation site . Activate the Orthen teleportation device outside the crypt, which unlocks the Incomplete Portal Network I special research and progresses the Teleport Node On mystery, then enter the site and excavate the varanusaur remains . Study the funeral pyre in the centre of the room to unlock the Breath of Fire special research mission. While excavating here you may find the four pages required to complete Crypt o' Zoology ; though these can also be found at later hotspots. While excavating at this hotspot or the dragonkin reliquary excavation hotspots at level 96, you may find four fragments of the Archaeology potion recipe . With level 90 Archaeology to the Know Thy Measure mystery can be completed. The Orthen Dig Site has a mechanic similar to the pylon at the Al-Kharid dig site. While excavating here you can find rex skeleton fragments which can be used to restore the rex skeleton at Anachronia base camp . When the skeleton has been fully completed by players across all game worlds the Roar of Osseous buff is activated. This gives 25% increased experience and a 10% increased chance to receive materials while training Archaeology on Anachronia for 65 minutes. Go to the Orthen - Crypt of Varanus excavation site and excavate the dragonkin coffins . You should now have all the artefacts required to complete the Museum - Dragonkin I and Dragonkin I artefact collections. Hand them in to Velucia and Sharrigan . If you have not already completed Crypt o' Zoology mystery then obtain all four of the required pages before moving on, as this is the last spot where they can be obtained. You may also find fragments of the Summoning renewal recipe while training here. At level 100 return to the Warforge and study Bandos's throne to unlock the Power Behind the Throne special research. Complete the research and excavate the kyzaj champion's boudoir hotspots in the Warforge - South goblin tunnels excavation site . Complete the You Have Chosen... mystery using one restored spear and one restored sculpture. You can also complete the Stick It to Da Boss Man achievement using a restored dorgeshuun spear; the spear is not consumed while completing the achievement. The Museum - Bandosian II collection can be completed for the first time by speaking to Velucia . This requires level 70 Runecrafting and 20 un-noted ancient vis . These hotspots may give pieces of the Summoning renewal recipe . You can also complete the Dragonkin II and Museum - Dragonkin II collections for the first time by handing in artefacts to Sharrigan and Velucia . Excavate the stockpiled art hotspots at the Everlight - Underwater cave excavation site . If you have not already done so you will need to progress the Hallowed Be... mystery up until the point where you access the underwater cave to the excavation site. While excavating here you will commonly obtain mosaic pieces . When you have 300 you can complete the Hallowed Be... mystery. A restored 'Hallowed Be the Everlight' painting is also required during the mystery, but it is not consumed. You can complete the Radiant Renaissance artefact collection for the first time. With level 105 Archaeology you can create a lit hallowed lantern and use it on the repaired Statue of Hebe to gain 'The Epic of Hebe' reward book. This can be read to receive 50,000 Archaeology experience. Repair the Orthen teleportation device outside the ritual site using 20 un-noted orthenglass . Enter the Orthen - Moksha ritual site excavation site and excavate the aughra remains . While excavating here you may find the four pages required to complete the Free Your Mind mystery. At the level 113 you will start training at the Orthen - Xolo city excavation site for the first time. You will need to complete the Fragmented Memories mystery to enter the site if you have not done so previously. Complete the Incomplete Portal Network III special research and restore the Orthen teleportation device outside Xolo City using 20 un-noted quintessence . You should now have restored all the teleportation devices, which completes the Teleport Node On mystery. At Xolo City excavate from the xolo mines . You can start to find the four pages required to complete the I Am Become Death mystery at this site, as well as fragments of the powerburst of opportunity recipe. Train at the traveller's stations . Complete the Dragonkin VII and Museum - Dragonkin VII artefact collections.
